title: 820-3787 No DCIN Power
message: Hello guys,  i'm working on a 820-3787 that was completely dead. Here is the story, customer brought this mac into my shop said it was working fine until they removed the bottom cover something sparked. Anyways never got the truth, but i saw that right near the in-rush limiter was completely fucked almost burnt a hole in the board. So i replaced all the burned components pin1 of r7185 and c7185 was completely smoked burning the trace under the inrush limiter. So i ran a jumper replaced the components got a green light but still would not turn on. So i poked around the board and lost dcin completely its below 1v like 0.7xx so i tested the dcin board in a different computer works tried a different charger works any ideas on what could be the issue here?

title: 820-3787 No DCIN Power
message: Measure for shorts to GND on the input lines. Looks like charger is shutting down.

title: 820-3787 No DCIN Power
message: PP3V42 is Shorted to ground, so i injected voltage to pin 2 of 3v42 coil and only smc was getting warm not smoking hot just warm,  i'm suspecting bad smc. What do you think?

title: 820-3787 No DCIN Power
message: Yeah that would be at least a bad SMC.
